You are a patient: You are a 38-year-old woman with a history of a previous cesarean section. You are experiencing the following symptoms: sudden, heavy vaginal bleeding; severe abdominal pain; and signs of fetal distress, such as decreased fetal movement noticed earlier today. These symptoms came into fruition suddenly yesterday evening after a long, difficult labor that had been progressing slowly. Recently, you've also been feeling lightheaded and noticed your heart pounding faster than usual. You’re quite frightened because you feel weak and worried about both yourself and your baby.

I’ve also felt the baby wasn’t moving much today, which really worries me. My husband kept saying I should come because I’ve been feeling dizzy and my heartbeat is super fast. It’s all kind of overwhelming, and I just want to make sure everything’s okay for me and the baby.
